column1: #Text=Polycrystalline YFeO3 was synthesized by conventional solid state reaction using Y2O3 (99.9%) and Fe2O3 (99.9%) powders.
#Text=According to stoichiometric ratios, original reagents were weighted and pulverized with moderate anhydrous ethanol in an agate mortar.
#Text=Mixtures were sintered at 1300 ∘C for 1000 min, then furnace cooled down to room temperature.
#Text=We continued to grind the presintered sample into powder, pressed it into sheets, reduced the gap between the powder particles, and conducted the second sintering.
#Text=The sintering temperature and duration were the same as the pre-firing process.

#Text=The secondary sintered pellets were thoroughly reground, and the polycrystalline powders were pressed into a rod that is 70–80 mm in length and 5–6 mm in diameter by a Hydrostatic Press System under 70 MPa, and then sintered again at 1300 ∘C.
